info.game_comments:
Chris Shea game 3.
J! round only.

(1, 1).clue: James Monroe so admired this man that he built a home near Monticello

(2, 1).clue: In 1891, during a 750-mile race of these 2-wheelers, assistants ringing bells kept the winner awake

(3, 1).clue: This was the middle name of John Sargent, who painted portraits, not sewing machines

(4, 1).clue: The world's longest official swim, almost 300 miles, was down this "Father of Waters"

(5, 1).clue: An actor named Thomas á Becket said he wrote this patriotic "Gem", but others claimed it too

(1, 2).clue: Southern spoon bread is made with this type of meal & eaten with a spoon

(2, 2).clue: In 1930 Herbert Hoover acquired a 16-cylinder limousine made by this company

(3, 2).clue: This son of a president isn't a "Junior" because his middle name is Prescott & his dad's is Wilson

(4, 2).clue: The "Complete Swimmer" says competitive swimming began about 1837 in this English city

(5, 2).clue: It was originally a poem titled "The Defense of Fort McHenry"

(6, 2).clue: The harbor chosen makes no difference if the weather is raging wind & rain

(1, 3).clue: Separated from Florida's mainland by the Indian & Banana Rivers, this cape's name means "cane break"

(2, 3).clue: MIT, NASA & others combined to work on the Daedalus Project, to make an airplane powered by this

(3, 3).clue: It's the middle name of Oscar winner Fahrid Abraham

(4, 3).clue: Reportedly, in 1928 Mercedes Gleitz became 1st person to swim this 8 mile Mediterranean passage

(5, 3).clue: The 2nd line of this beloved patriotic song is "land that I love"

(6, 3).clue: The baseball field just off the golf fairway

(1, 4).clue: Until the 1970s Louisiana had the longest of these in the U.S., containing over a quarter-million words

(2, 4).clue: In 1954 the 1st Canadian subway opened in this city

(3, 4).clue: This famous feminist's middle initial stood for Brownell

(4, 4).clue: This stroke always comes last in medley relays

(5, 4).clue: Song that says, "You're the emblem of the land I love"

(6, 4).clue: Turn over a Granny Smith conveyance

(1, 5).clue: George Washington planned to drain & farm this huge swamp in Virginia

(2, 5).clue: These are actually wingless aircraft that fly just inches off the water

(3, 5).clue: As any little bird could tell you, it was  Audubon's middle name

(4, 5).clue: Diving position where diver stays bent at hips with legs held straight & grasps the back of the knees

(5, 5).clue: The song parody "Be Kind to Your Web-Footed Friends" is sung to the tune of this patriotic march

(6, 5).clue: Autographed, shut up tight, then taken to the person specified
